Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Norse \Norse\ (n[^o]rs), prop. a. [Dan. Norsk, fr. nord north. See {North}.] Of or pertaining to ancient Scandinavia, or to the language spoken by its inhabitants. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Norse \Norse\, prop. n. The Norse language. [1913 Webster]

Norse adj 1: of or relating to Scandinavia or its peoples or cultures; "Norse sagas"; "Norse nomads" [syn: {Scandinavian}] 2: of or relating to Norway or its people or culture or language; "Norwegian herring" [syn: {Norwegian}] n 1: an inhabitant of Scandinavia [syn: {Scandinavian}, {Northman}] 2: a native or inhabitant of Norway [syn: {Norwegian}, {Norseman}] 3: the northern family of Germanic languages that are spoken in Scandinavia and Iceland [syn: {Scandinavian}, {Scandinavian language}, {Nordic}, {North Germanic}, {North Germanic language}]
